fields.description: Loading up all the issues takes up a lot of memory.
fields.summary: The excel view loads up all the issues into memory just to check if the are any results

fields.description: This can cause big problems as if the search request find a lot of issues even if the user requests only first say 100, all of the issues are served. This can take a while.
fields.summary: Search request views do not respect tempMax parameter

fields.description: The Comment object now check for a null body and blows up. Due to JRA-11485 we could have some historic data out there that have comment records in the database with null bodies. This should not happen normally. We need to thin through support implecations of this and decide if the null check should be removed.
fields.summary: Need to investigate whether to remove the check for null body from the Comment object

fields.summary: Issue printable view sometimes results in NPE in Default Velocity Manager

fields.description:
A lot of velocity code (e.g. for Custom Field Views) has been converted not to use the request object (to get the Context Path) but to use the VelocityRequestContext object. We need to ensure that when sending HTML e-mail that the code still works correctly. That is, that an instance of VelocityRequestContext is avaialble in the Velocity Context.

Need to check normal notification e-mail, as well as specifically check sending a HTML e-mail for Search Request Subscription.
fields.summary: Need to ensure that HTML e-mail respect VelocityRequestContext

fields.description:
At least in Firefox the menus clsoe but do not open.

Clicking Show All in administration section does work.
fields.summary: Collapsible menus in Administration do not reopen

fields.description: Lazy loading does not seem to work on Safari. For example, the saved filters portlet does not load the counts on Safari, which should be lazy loaded.
fields.summary: Lazy loading does not work in Safari

fields.description: Looks like the font of the Quick Search in 3.7 Beta is incorrect.
fields.summary: The font of the Quick Search is wrong

fields.description:
The redirect for the new XML views loses the search parameters. 

For example:
http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&&created%3Aprevious=-2w&pid=10240&resolution=-1&sorter/field=issuekey&sorter/order=DESC&view=rss&decorator=none

Ends up to be:
http://jira.atlassian.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchreqest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml
fields.summary: The redirect for RSS feeds loses parameters

fields.description:
Header from WebService call to http://jira.atlassian.com/rpc/soap/jirasoapservice-v2 responds with

<HTTPHeaders>
  <date>Sun, 12 Nov 2006 02:19:07 GMT</date> 
  <server>Apache/2.0.52 (Red Hat)</server> 
  <keep-alive>timeout=15, max=100</keep-alive> 
  <connection>Keep-Alive</connection> 
  <transfer-encoding>chunked</transfer-encoding> 
  <content-type>text/plain; charset=UTF-8</content-type> 
</HTTPHeaders>

This causes a soap client to complain that the content type is supposed to be text/xml

Seems that this is the same issue as JRA-10743
fields.summary: SOAP Response Content Type is 'text/plain' instead of 'text/xml'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-11506].
  {panel}

Hi

I want to generate all my project management reporting out of Jira.  In order for me to do this most effectively I need some additional attributes associated with each "Version" within a Project.

At the we have the following attributes associated with a Version:
- Version Name
- Description
- Release Date
- Schedule

I require the following additional attributes:
- Start Date (estimated start date for items within the Version)
- Owner (The owner of a particular Version.  This would be some the list of users with access to the Jira project)

If you could support a flexible way to add custom fields to Versions that would be best
fields.summary: Require additional attributes associated with Versions

fields.description:
WikiRenderer doesn't render [notes://] links. DefaultTextRenderer does. For details why, [please see this comment below|#action_68014]

The documentation says I can create hyperlinks in the Description field, using WIKI markup, by surrounding my link with '[' and ']'. I would like to be able to create links to Notes documents, using the notes:// protocol, and this appears to have been addressed earlier at

[http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-2096]

If I embed an http:// hyperlink, as above, it works. If I embed a [notes://] hyperlink, it doesn't.

Curiously, it does appear to work in fields other than Description. If I put a [notes://] link in a comment, the link works. It also works if I generate a custom field of type URL and paste the notes:// hyperlink into that. The WIKI renderer is enabled for the Description field.
 * Here is a sample Description field entry:{panel}Here's a list of multiple jobs that need to be patched:

Correct handling of bad blocks inside a read request
 *-
 [Notes://alphamosaic-m01/80256E460038EF1B/AAC7D56CA8FD884B852563BE00610639/8532F02196D6FCC48025721F0045D5CC]
 Merged functional improvements from the trunk
 *-
 [Notes://alphamosaic-m01/80256E460038EF1B/AAC7D56CA8FD884B852563BE00610639/6872C1BE4F98BD3D802571FE00312DA4]
{panel}

 * What should happen is that the Notes references become hyperlinks.
 * What actually happens is that I get plain text

h3. Additional requested protocols to support

From the comments, we have to add a support for these protocols too:
 * svn://
 * [file://|file:///]
 * notes://

(on) As an idea - to make this pluggable, admin user can define JIRA-wide the list of supported protocol prefixes.
h3. Workarounds
 * Use a text render (or an additional field with a text renderer), since the text renderer properly handles the links.
 * Use a browser plug-in in a user browsers, to replace certain protocol links with the real links.
fields.summary: Cannot create notes:// hyperlinks in Description field using WIKI renderer

fields.summary: The JIRAIssueLink renderer is too verbose in logging exceptions if the issue key is not found

fields.description:
In JIRA's default text-renderer (*not* wiki), if I write:

<url>http://foo</url>

It comes out as:

{noformat}
<url>http://foo</url>
{noformat}

According to [rfc1738|http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1738.txt], valid chars ("uchars") are defined by the BNF:


{noformat}
uchar          = unreserved | escape
unreserved     = alpha | digit | safe | extra
alpha          = lowalpha | hialpha
digit          = "0" | "1" | "2" | "3" | "4" | "5" | "6" | "7" |
safe           = "$" | "-" | "_" | "." | "+"
extra          = "!" | "*" | "'" | "(" | ")" | ","
escape         = "%" hex hex
{noformat}

Ie, less-than signs (<'s) are not allowed because, as the RFC says, {quote}The characters "<" and ">" are unsafe because they are used as the
   delimiters around URLs in free text{quote}

JIRA's automatic URLifying code should only include valid chars in the URL. It seem the Wiki renderer code gets this right.
fields.summary: Automatic URLification of text includes unsafe characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-11480].
  {panel}

One of important features of any workflow, task-management, project-management software is an alerter functionality. Currently, Jira supports only e-mail alerts, plus some 3-d party extensions are available, which are not convenient (some require a specific JDK and run as a stand-alone application, some support a specific browser only). All these alerters can be treated only as a temporary work-arounds for a native built-in http alerter, to be provided by Jira.

As Jira's client is a browser, the most natural and convenient way of getting alerts is on Jira's html pages. I'd suppose, that http alerter should comprise a listener (perhaps, the same one as for e-mail alerts will suite with minor changes?) and a client-side renderer of a dynamic html. The renderer must fetch a data from the listener every predefined period of time (configurable by a user) and place its statistics on top of currently opened Jira page. I mean that the div tag, which is supposed to be used for the rendering, must be placed in common header (a mean the leading bar on top of every page above Jira's menu or the Jira's menu itself; both have an empty space at the right side) for all Jira pages. The statistics of the http alerter should show how many new issues are available by priority, for example: New issues: 1/2/3/4 (8 total), where 1/2/3/4 - are number of issues in all priorities, starting with a highest priority. The text should be a link, which allows a user to open a filter showing all the new issues.

How long an issue should be treated as a "new" one and listed in the alerter statistic - this is a question. Because the http alerter should provide the same cumulative quality, which e-mail provides by means of inbox, I'd suggest, that new issues remain in the http alerter list until either they viewed in the abovementioned filter, or each one of them is opened by user (in this case issues may leave the alerter list separately). The easiest way is, of course, just to clear the alerter list every time a user clicks the alerter link. The best way is to track the newness of each issue based on whether it was actually viewed by a user or not.

I think, everyone agree, that properly placed and timely alerts will make Jira much more efficient, than the static and annoying "hit refresh yourself" approach offered now.

E-mail alerts are not convenient and involve technical overheads: they require to have and to switch to another application, they flood inbox with a lot of e-mail, which are actually not e-mails and will be deleted once a user switched back to Jira and processed corresponding issues; they lack usability overall.
fields.summary: HTTP alerter is a must

fields.description:
Most of the SMTP servers are requiring SMTP authentication in order to relay the mail to other domain. 

For Example:
{quote}
Some logs of sending email to different domain without authentication:
MAIL FROM: mailto:terry@mycompany.com
250 2.1.0 mailto:terry@mycompany.com... Sender ok
RCPT TO: mailto:terry@yourcompany.com
550 5.7.1 mailto:terry@yourcompany.com... Relaying denied. IP name lookup failed [xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx]
{quote}
To prevent this problem, we should emphasize that the username and password are REQUIRED for sending to external domains (eg. for sending support requests)

Terry
fields.summary: Prevent mail relaying problems with more descriptive text in Mail Servers

fields.description:
There a few Operations that are some distance away from the information they are acting upon.
It would be good to move these links next to their items.  GUI's these days are moving towards actionable ui objects, not lists of actions.

Good candidates are:
* *Assign Issue* - Make the Assignee label clickable and move the {{Assign to me}} link to the end of the line.
* *Attach File* can be removed and {{Manage Attachments}} should have a form to add attachments.
* *Comment* could be moved to the bottom of the page (Who doesn't read the last comment before tehy comment)
* *Link Issue* can be moved to the links section
* *Voting* can be moved to the Voting Label.  Make this label clickable and ahve a little vote icon next to it.
* *Watching* can be dealt with teh same way as voting.
* *Log Work* can be moved up to the Time tracking fields.

And while we are it - AJAXify Voting, watching and Assign to me...


Pros:
* Operations are in the same place as their displayed info
* A more dynamic interface
* A cleaner interface - a user perceives their to be less operations...  (I still need to search the list every time to do some of the operations)

Cons:
* Not all operations in the same place
* Some areas could become cluttered....

Though I am not a UI expert...
fields.summary: Inline some operation links (put them next to their relivent info)

fields.description:
One of the most frequently requested UI modifications is the ability to insert customfields into the Summary Panel for the View Issue and HTML email pages.

Not sure if this is best done as a fragment or configurable in the Admin section via a Web GUI (Wouldn't be too hard...).  You could treat it as a seperate screen...
fields.summary: Make Issue Summary panel plugable

fields.description:
I maintain an application which contains links for users to raise support tickets in JIRA.

According to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+via+direct+HTML+links I should be able to direct my users directly to http://<jira host>:8080/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa to submit a ticket.  However, while I know what project they wish to raise the ticket against, if I do not know what Issue Type they wish to enter, I cannot populate the query string correctly.  I have compromised and linked to this page directly so that they must manually select the project and Issue Type.  Which works, if they are logged in.  If they are not logged in, instead of being directed to the login page, they get the error as listed in the attached screenshot, "You have not selected a valid project to create an issue in."  I would have thought that the user would instead be directed to a login page.
fields.summary: Error when linking directly to CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa

fields.description:
We have come across a Bugzilla database with a project that fails to import, breaking with:

Error importing data from Bugzilla: java.lang.NullPointerException at com.atlassian.jira.project.version.DefaultVersionManager.getVersion(DefaultVersionManager.java:464) at com.atlassian.jira.util.BugzillaImportBean.createVersion(BugzillaImportBean.java:870) at com.atlassian.jira.util.BugzillaImportBean.createVersionFromVersionTable(BugzillaImportBean.java:785) at com.atlassian.jira.util.BugzillaImportBean.createVersions(BugzillaImportBean.java:767) at com.atlassian.jira.util.BugzillaImportBean.create(BugzillaImportBean.java:198) at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.util.BugzillaImport.doRun(BugzillaImport.java:150) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) at
...

It turns out this is because there is a {{versions}} table record:

{noformat}
+-------------+-----------+
| value       | program   |
+-------------+-----------+
| unspecified | app:AUdIT | 
+-------------+-----------+
1 row in set (0.00 sec)
{noformat}

But the {{products.product}} column value is actually {{app:AUDIT}}:

{noformat}
mysql> select product from products where product like 'app:AUdiT';
+-----------+
| product   |
+-----------+
| app:AUDIT | 
+-----------+
{noformat}

1 row in set (0.03 sec)


  The case difference doesn't matter to Bugzilla, because MySQL is case-insensitive. However the JIRA importer puts the product name in a case-sensitive map, and so it breaks.
fields.summary: Bugzilla importer: NullPointerException when version is invalid

fields.description:
The definiton of the Interface AttachmentManager contains the following method

{code:title=http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/3.6.4/com/atlassian/jira/issue/AttachmentManager.html}
public ChangeItemBean createAttachment(File file,
                                       String filename,
                                       String contentType,
                                       User remoteUser,
                                       org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericValue issue,
                                       Map attachmentProperties,
                                       Date createdTime)
                                throws AttachmentException,
                                       org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException
{code}
Actually the {{Date createdTime}} refers to {{java.util.Date}} but the underlying ofbiz layer does not support it. Instead of {{java.util.Date}} it can persist {{java.sql.Date}} which is a subclass of it. The following stack trace shows what happens with {{java.util.Date}}:
{noformat}
org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericNotImplementedException: Java type java.util.Date not currently supported. Sorry.
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SqlJdbcUtil.getType(SqlJdbcUtil.java:720)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SqlJdbcUtil.setValue(SqlJdbcUtil.java:632)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SqlJdbcUtil.setValue(SqlJdbcUtil.java:601)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SqlJdbcUtil.setValues(SqlJdbcUtil.java:436)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.singleInsert(GenericDAO.java:114)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.insert(GenericDAO.java:88)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.create(GenericHelperDAO.java:63)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.create(GenericDelegator.java:470)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.create(GenericDelegator.java:450)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericValue.create(GenericValue.java:77)
        at com.atlassian.core.ofbiz.util.EntityUtils.createValue(EntityUtils.java:61)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager.createAttachment(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:101)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager.createAttachment(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:202)
        .....
{noformat}
I suppose that the definition of the method (and the other createAttachment method) and the implementing class should be changed to {{java.sql.Date}}.

h4. Workaround
Use {{java.sql.Date}} instead of {{java.util.Date}}
fields.summary: The definition of the Interface AttachmentManager is inconsistent with ofbiz

fields.description:
For debugging mail problems (POP, IMAP, SMTP), the JavaMail library provides the {{mail.debug}} property. When [set|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Setting+properties+and+options+on+startup] to {{true}}, this prints protocol-level logs showing what is happening.

This works for SMTP, but does not work for POP or IMAP (eg. creating issues/comments from mail). In the library, we instead initialise the JavaMail properties from the {{WEB-INF/classes/atlassian-mail.properties}} file.  So to get debug logs for POP and IMAP, you'd need to create {{WEB-INF/classes/atlassian-mail.properties}} and add the line:

{{mail.debug=true}}

and then restart.

JIRA should allow command-line properties to override those in {{atlassian-mail.properties}}, so that people don't have to set properties in a text file in a .war.
fields.summary: -Dmail.debug property does not work for POP/IMAP

fields.description:
The custom field configuration links (e.g. for default value, options) on the  ConfigureCustomField action always use the id of the fieldconfigscheme for both the fieldconfigscheme and the fieldconfiguration parameters. If the tables fieldconfigscheme and fieldconfiguration are not id-matched for each custom field, this can lead to unexpected results such as configuring the wrong field or a 500 page caused by a null pointer exception.

There is no known way the data can become inconsistent in this way except by direct modification of the database, but there is no data integrity violation and the link is clearly wrong.

The error is in the expression on line 70 of configurecustomfield.jsp where the id for the fieldconfiguration should be given the value of "../key/id". Instead it doesn't resolve (as "../id" so Webwork (in its wisdom) walks up the value stack and finds the fieldconfigscheme id which just happens to be the correct value for the fieldconfiguration id in all normal cases. One case where it is not the same is in the example provided for [JSP-7492|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-7492] where there is something strange in the data making the ids of those two tables unaligned.
fields.summary: In certain data the custom field configuration links are wrong

fields.description:
As identified here, 

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-7492

It appears that the patched file corrects a long standing problem that can only be uncovered when the ids of fieldconfigurations and fieldconfgschemes are not the same for the same fields. Legend has it that the CSV importer could cause such a situation to occur (when importing non global custom fields)  even though it can't be caused using the admin UI. 

Fix the the bug as per the patch on [JSP-7492|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-7492] and investigate the CSV importer bug.
fields.summary: Add fix for issue identified with editing custom fields where scheme id is not the same as fieldconfig id

fields.description: The step one of the Create New Issue functionality is (AFAIK) a HTTP-safe operation and therefore should use the HTTP method GET. This would allow users to bookmark frequently used specific create-issue forms (e.g. "Create bug report for JIRA" or "Create task for Confluence"). Additionally, it would remove the unwanted POST/200 pattern used in this case (see the POST-redirect-GET pattern, aka PRG or POST/303).
fields.summary: Create New Issue, Step one form uses submission method POST instead of GET

Mike

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm trying to construct a jelly script to create permission schemes for a list of projects.

See the following script:

<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib" xmlns:j="jelly:core" xmlns:u="jelly:util">
  <u:tokenize var="projects" delim=",">PROJECT1,PROJECT2</u:tokenize>
  <j:forEach items="${projects}" var="project">
    <jira:CreatePermissionScheme name="${project} Permission Scheme">
      <jira:AddPermission type="reporter" permissions="Edit,ScheduleIssue"/>
      <jira:AddPermission type="assignee" permissions="Resolve,Work,Link,ViewVersionControl,ManageWatcherList"/>
      <jira:AddPermission group="${project}-testers" permissions="Assignable,Resolve" type="group"/>
      <jira:AddPermission group="${project}-developers" permissions="Assignable,ViewVersionControl" type="group"/>
      <jira:AddPermission group="${project}-team-leader" permissions="ScheduleIssue,ModifyReporter,Edit,Assign,Assignable,Delete,Move,ManageWatcherList,ViewVersionControl,Resolve,Close" type="group"/>
      <jira:AddPermission group="${project}-managers" permissions="Project,ScheduleIssue,Edit,Assign,Assignable,Delete,Move,ManageWatcherList,ViewVersionControl" type="group"/>
      <jira:AddPermission group="jira-administrators" permissions="Project,Delete,Browse" type="group"/>
    </jira:CreatePermissionScheme>
    <jira:SelectProjectScheme projectKey="${project}" permission-scheme="${project} Permission Scheme"/>
  </j:forEach>
</JiraJelly>

The result of this script is wrong.

The 2 permission schemes are created BUT all the permissions are fixed within the first permission scheme!

Kind regards,

Bruno
fields.summary: CreatePermissionScheme and AddPermission error within a foreach

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-11384].
  {panel}

As a Project Manager I find the Version Workload Report quite useful however it suffers from some limitations:

1 - it assumes that ALL issues in the version are in the same active 'state' which in our organisation are based on a custom field. 
2 - if a 'Project' encompasses more than one project in jira multiple reports need to be run

 We use a filters to be able to list issues according to the state they are in across projects as necessary, however, the Version Workload Report doesn't allow Filters to be used to filter down the contents of the report.

Please can either the Version Workload Report pick up filters from the user's filter list as well as the versions and to create the same output, or a new report be created that results in the same output?
fields.summary: Version Workload Report - improvement or create a different report effectively a Filter Workload Report

fields.description: The RemoteAPI (XML-RPC / SOAP) is not thread-safe. For example, simultaneously updating a customfield value of an issue causes data corruption.
fields.summary: Remote API concurrency issue

fields.description:
The {{projectSecurityLevels}} Map used to cache Issue Security Levels is not synchronized in {{com.atlassian.jira.issue.security.IssueLevelSecurities}}.

If concurrent requests reach this map before it is initialised it can cause JIRA to appear unresponsive and use lots of CPU.
fields.summary: Unsynchronized HashMap in IssueLevelSecurities class

fields.description:
see http://www.bugzilla.org/docs/2.20/html/userpreferences.html:
 "Users to watch". When you enter one or more comma-delineated user accounts (usually email addresses) into the text entry box, you will receive a copy of all the bugmail those users are sent (security settings permitting). This powerful functionality enables seamless transitions as developers change projects or users go on holiday.

In addition this allows managers/leads to be aware of all traffic related/waiting on their reports.

JIRA doesn't allow this, which is a shame.

leads can get notification based on component leadership, or various other notification mechanisms, but nothing that allows monitoring all traffic another user gets. 

A clunky workaround is to create a filter for bugs reported/assigned to a group and subscribe to that report. if by RSS this will work, although many people still like email instead of rss...
If by email subscription by default the full filter results are sent, not the deltas since the last invocation. The only workaround here is to set the filter to only show differences in the period of time equal to the subscription frequency. As I said, clunky.

It will be much better to be able to define a list of users/groups you are watching, or at least to define the "lead" for each user so another user can get all their JIRA email traffic.
fields.summary: JIRA should have a similar option to the "User Watching" in bugzilla

fields.description: Would be quite helpful to see which database instance is used currently
fields.summary: Display database name in System Info

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-11371].
  {panel}

It is very awkward to create bugs filter that specified a range of versions.
for example all the bugs that affect 3.6.3 to 3.6.5 
In other enterprise-level issue trackers its possible to filter by ranges e.g. affected>=3.6.3 and affected<=3.6.5
or similar requirement affected==3.6.X

This is a mandatory requirement for robust operation in an enterprise environment. 

Currently you need to manually add all of the versions/builds to your filters, which is very awkward as you add builds/versions.
fields.summary: It should be possible to look for a range of versions in a filter

fields.description:
Folks,

You specify fixed font sizes for the JIRA fields. I'll check and see if this is in the CSS. If that is the case, I'll be able to fix it (I'm pretty sure I'll be able to address it).

I got complaints from a Chinese and a Japanese user that they can't enlarge the font enough to be able to decipher Kanji/Chinese script.

We need to allow them to enlarge the font enough to be able to view the script.

As I said, I'll probably be able to address this in CSS, but you might want to look at what you are distributing.

This is immediately visible in the "Edit Preferences" page. When my engineer enlarged the font, the outer areas and the admin menu enlarged, but the part in the work area did not enlarge. In addition, bold text is the enemy of Kanji.
fields.summary: Fixed Font Size BAD Usability for Kanji/Chinese Fonts

fields.description:

Whether I request that the field is changed to <empty string> value, or to no value (empty array of strings), the request is ignored. No errors are given, the value stays in place. The problem is reproducible always.

Request and reply SOAP xmls are attached.
fields.summary: Cannot clear import id custom field through SOAP

fields.description:
Original Description:
{noformat}
Hotkeys (e.g. ALT-S, ALT-A, ALT-M) do not work when using Firefox 2.0

Hot keys that map to menus (i.e. ALT-B = Bookmarks) that used to trigger operations in Firefox 1.5 now open the menu.
Hot keys that don't map to menus don't work either.

I haven't figured out whether this is a Firefox or a Jira issue (in terms of who is doing things correctly), but it's a major pain either way.
{noformat}

Firefox 2 now uses {{ALT + SHIFT + accesskey}} to access all access keys in content.  This was done to resolve conflicts with menus.

We need to update documentation and also detect what browser they are using and modify the tooltips accordingly.
fields.summary: Document Hot keys in Firefox 2 and change tooltips

fields.description:
When a user exports to excel by clicking on 'All Fields' the date formats in Excel differ between issues (rows).

Some result in the general form (05/Oct/06 10:56 AM) while others use the 24hour format like so (22/09/2006 14:11:00).

For more information see [JSP-7554|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-7554].

h4. Workaround
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Date+format+changes+after+exporting+to+Excel
fields.summary: Date format is inconsistent during Export to Excel
